channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sand washed into road gulley, 6th January
item.description:
Following work by TWA to Repairs to a water main, a lot of sand from the excavations has been washed into the road gulley outside Nos, 4, 6, & 8 Heathside BR5 1EY. This gully is the principle recipient of surface water from Heathside & Broadcroft Rd. a visit by the gulley gulper would be appreciated.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heathside, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sheet ice - treacherous to vehicles and people, 6th January
item.description:
Water has been pouring down the hill for a couple of days. Road is now sheet ice. Thames Water have been out to check but van slid on the ice into a building and man slipped over when assessing the problem. Road needs to be closed to vehicles and gritted urgently please
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Susan Wood, Chislehurst, Greater London

item.title: Pile of rubbish blocking path and attracting rodents, 6th January
item.description:
I am contacting you regarding rubbish that has been accumulating at the end of Miriam Road near the Conway Road corner ( What3words reference: ///pulled.later.reply ). During the summer of 2025 some tape was placed round 3 black bags of rubbish under a tree stating it was under investigation. These bags then sat here for multiple months rotting in the sun. On the week of 22nd of December 2025 more bags have appeared until the path is now almost blocked. I am hoping that you can facilitate collection and removal of this hazard just round the corner from a primary school. I would like to request no tape is placed round it just to be left there as it is attracting rodents. I have attached images as proof.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Miriam Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter along Wellington Gardens, 6th January
item.description:
The whole street needs sweeping as there is litter all along the kerbs and around wheelie bins left on pavement, plus fly tipping, abandoned supermarket trolleys etc. There has been no sweeping for MONTHS and the litter bin which used to be at the Victoria Way end of the street "disappeared" in May 2025 and despite repeated requests from residents has never been replaced.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wellington Gardens, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet
